title: Peer-to-peer Patching
body: I've heard that using the peer-to-peer option can speed up a patch, but I don't know how to set two computers up for that.  Or is it automatic?  Anyone know how to use this?

replies.body: P2P isn't between your own computers, but downloading data from many users instead of directly from Riot's servers. It *may* be faster, but it might not be. You can enable it by clicking the gear icon on the top right of your launcher and selecting the checkbox.

The peer to peer patching option actually doesn't do anything currently.  It used to be part of an installation bundled with League of Legends a very long time go, and is no longer used.  The patcher now downloads any necessary files through our patching servers.  More information on this is also provided through the [announcement ](http://na.leagueoflegends.com/en/news/game-updates/features/upcoming-pando-media-booster-removal)of its removal.  I hope that clears some things up!
